bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: Pathological Condition of worms infestation whereby moisture has entered the spleen and stomach in a situation of depletion and weakness resulting from incessant diarrhea. The illness signs are frequent panting, ulcers on the upper lip, mental vexation, and depression, or ulcers on the lower lip, and anal decay. In severe cases the lips, mouth, and gums all develop ulcers. The teeth blacken and decay; blood and watery liquid flow freely. Zhu bing yuan hou lun 諸病源候論 18 ：濕䘌病，由脾胃虛弱，為水濕所乘，腹 內蟲動，侵食成䘌也 , “The disease of moisture hidden-worms infestation results from an intrusion of moisture into a depleted and weak spleen and stomach. This causes worms to move in the abdomen. They enter and feed [on the organs], and this causes hidden-worms infestation”.
